business.headline: Meta layoffs: Decided to move out low-performers, says CEO Mark ZuckerbergThe decision, shared in an internal memo by CEO Mark Zuckerberg, focusses on improving overall performance by moving out those not meeting expectations more quickly than before.

Stocks to watch today: HDFC Life, Adani Energy, Vedanta, IRFC, Sula VineyardsShares of companies such as HDFC Life, Adani Energy, Vedanta, IRFC, CESC, Sula Vineyards, and Shoppers Stop are likely to remain in focus today due to news developments and quarterly results announcements.

'We wouldn't do that': ITC chief Sanjiv Puri shares view on 90-hour workweekThe 90-hour workweek debate, triggered by L&T chairman SN Subrahmanyan's comments, has faced criticism from industry leaders and celebrities.
Mutual fund investors can now nominate up to 10 individuals. Details hereThe new rules enhance investor convenience while ensuring that the nomination process remains secure and transparent.

Are mutual funds risky in a turbulent stock market? Here's all you need to knowIs market turbulence shaking your mutual fund confidence? Find out why experts urge patience and see volatility as a buying opportunity, not a cause for alarm.
ITR filing: Why you should file belated, revised tax returns by January 15Taxpayers missing the original deadline must file a belated ITR to meet obligations.
Credit score check: Why and how often should you review it?A credit score is a numerical measure of your creditworthiness, based on payment history, debt, and credit history length.
Sensex, Nifty snap losing streak to end higher; Adani stocks gain up to 7%The S&P BSE Sensex gained169.62 points to close at 76,499.63, while the NSE Nifty50 added 90.10 points to end at 23,176.05.

Looking for an online personal loan? Check these 7 simple steps To avoid delays in your online personal loan application, ensure you meet the eligibility criteria and have all necessary documents ready.

Budget 2025: How government can prioritise job creation and skill development The upcoming Budget 2025 is expected to focus on economic growth while addressing key challenges and leveraging opportunities.
Explained: Why Biocon shares surged 7% today Biocon share price: The stock has gained 9.66% in the last month, 7.99% over the past six months, and an impressive 37.98% in the last year.
Budget 2025: What NRIs are expecting from Nirmala SitharamanAll eyes are on the Union Budget 2025, set to be announced in February, for key reform announcements.

HCLTech shares tumble nearly 10% after Q3 results. What should investors do?Several brokerages have shared their views on the IT giant's Q3 results. Brokerage firm Morgan Stanley maintained an 'Equal-Weight' rating with a target price of Rs 1,970.
Truly disheartening: L&T HR head defends chairman amid 90-hour workweek rowL&T Chairman S N Subrahmanyan's 90-hour workweek remark has triggered debate on work-life balance.

Adani Power, Adani Green: Why Adani Group shares jumped up to 18% todayAdani Group shares: At 12:05 pm, Adani Power soared 18.05% to Rs 531.40 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE), while Adani Green Energy climbed 14.15% to Rs 1,015.80. Adani Enterprises, the group's flagship company, was trading 8% higher at Rs 2,401.75.

JSW Energy shares price rises 6% today. Here's why JSW Energy share price: The stock has lost 20.14% in the last month and 23.69% over the past six months. Despite the recent decline, JSW Energy has gained 16.15% over the past year.

JSW Energy share price jumps nearly 7%. Why is it gaining today?JSW energy share price: The stock opened at Rs 528.15, and climbed to an intraday high of Rs 552.50 at around 11:07 am, marking a jump of 6.59% jump.

Explained: Why HCLTech share price fell nearly 10% despite positive Q3 resultsHCLTech share price: At 10:46 am, HCLTech's shares were trading 9.02% lower at Rs 1,806.20 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). Earlier, its shares hit an intraday low of Rs 1,798.40.

Sensex, Nifty rebound: What's driving today's gains, and will the recovery last?Despite today's rally, the stock market remains under pressure due to several factors, especially the impact of Q3 earnings and sustained selling by foreign institutional investors.

Quadrant Future Tek listing: Shares make strong D-Street debut at 27% premium Quadrant Future Tek stock: The stock opened at Rs 370 on the NSE, reflecting a 27.5% premium over its IPO price of Rs 290.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline:
Centre grants ED approval to prosecute Arvind Kejriwal in liquor policy caseIn an order last November, the Supreme Court said that the ED has to take prior sanction before prosecuting public servants.
The following month, the probe agency wrote to VK Saxena, saying that granting of a sanction should be given since Kejriwal was the "kingpin and key conspirator" of the scam.

South Korea's Yoon becomes 1st sitting President to be arrestedIn an attempt to arrest the South Korean President, more than 3,000 police officers and anti-corruption investigators had gathered outside his residence before dawn on Wednesday.

Dense fog covers Delhi-NCR, visibility reduced, flights hit; rain likely todayDelhi-NCR was engulfed in a thick layer of fog on Wednesday morning, reducing visibility to almost zero in several parts. Several flights and trains have been affected due to the fog.

Trump engaged in criminal effort to retain power after 2020 polls: Probe reportIn an over 130-page report published on Tuesday, US Special Counsel Jack Smith details how Donald Trump tried to overturn the 2020 election results and criminally attempted to subvert the will of the people.
Is Northeast India finally getting its due as a travel destination?Both experts and data highlight a growing preference amongst travellers for the Northeast as a travel destination.

Elon Musk sued for not disclosing stake in Twitter before buying platform Elon Musk was sued on Tuesday by the US Securities and Exchange Commission for waiting too long to disclose in 2022 he had amassed a large stake in Twitter, the social media company he later bought.

Portrait that replaced 1971 war painting links past, present and future: Army chiefThe painting on the 1971 war was removed from the Army chief General Upendra Dwivedi's lounge in December, and it was subsequently installed at the Manekshaw convention centre.

Case against Haryana BJP chief, singer Rocky Mittal for alleged gang-rapeThe woman alleged that she was forced to consume alcohol and subsequently gang-raped by Haryana BJP chief Mohan Lal Badoli and singer Rocky Mittal at a hotel in Himachal Pradesh's Kasauli in 2023.

Black Warrant and the Ranga-Billa case: What really happened in and out of jailBlack Warrant, a prison drama, is currently streaming on Netflix. The show is based on a book of the same title and one of its episodes narrates the story of the infamous Ranga-Billa case.

Work longer or smarter? India debates L&T chief's '90-hour' work-week L&T chairman S.N. Subrahmanyan isn't the only corporate leader to have advocated longer work hours despite the proven detrimental impact on employee wellbeing and productivity

Kate Middleton says she's relieved to be in remission after cancer treatmentKate Middleton, the Princess of Wales, said she was in remission from cancer and stressed she was "relieved" after she was diagnosed with the disease a year ago.

Meta layoffs: Decided to move out low-performers, says CEO Mark ZuckerbergThe decision, shared in an internal memo by CEO Mark Zuckerberg, focusses on improving overall performance by moving out those not meeting expectations more quickly than before.

Who are the Naga Sadhus? Highlight of the Maha KumbhThe Naga Sadhus are India's mysterious warrior-ascetics, central to the Maha Kumbh Mela. Who are they, where do they come from, and where do they go after the festival?

India 'strongly' seeks return of nationals after Kerala man dies in Russia warKerala electrician Binil TB, recruited into Russia's Military Support Service, recently died in Ukraine's war zone. The Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) has 'strongly' demanded early repatriation of remaining Indians deputed at the front line.

2020 Delhi riots accused Tahir Hussain granted custody parole for poll nominationAIMIM leader Tahir Hussain was granted custody parole by the Delhi High Court to file his nomination for the Mustafabad Assembly constituency in the upcoming Delhi elections.

Sheikh Hasina's niece resigns as UK's anti-corruption minister after graft claimsTulip Siddiq, ousted Bangladesh Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina's niece, resigned as the UK's anti-corruption minister after facing allegations over whether her family were involved in siphoning off funds from Bangladeshi infrastructure projects.

Pics: Inside Sobhita Dhulipala, Naga Chaitanya's first Sankranti after weddingNaga Chaitanya and Sobhita Dhulipala celebrated their first Sankranti months after their wedding. The Made in Heaven actor gave us a sneak-peek of their Sankranti celebrations.

Ex-Union Minister, councillor Ariba Khan in Congress's 3rd list for Delhi pollsFormer Union Minister and veteran Congress leader Krishna Tirath has been fielded from Patel Nagar while Ariba Khan will face incumbent AAP MLA Amanatullah Khan in Okhla in February 5 Delhi Assembly polls.

No parking space, no car: Maharashtra to soon enforce new rule for buyersMaharashtra Transport Minister Pratap Sarnaik emphasised that the unregulated parking of vehicles often leads to severe consequences, including the obstruction of emergency services like ambulances and fire brigades.

Trinamool leader claims assault by party workers over refusal to pay 'cut money'Trinamool Congress (TMC) Gram Panchayat Pradhan Buli Murmu has alleged that she was physically assaulted by her party colleagues for refusing to pay "cut money" from funds allocated for road construction.

Navya Nanda shares solo Rann of Kutch pics, Shweta Bachchan asks if she went aloneNavya Naveli Nanda shares breathtaking photos from her visit to the Rann of Kutch, however, it was her mother, Shweta Bachchan's witty comment that gave a hilarious touch to Navya's post.

SpaceX launches Firefly satellites developed by India's PixxelThe launch took place from Vandenberg Space Force Base in California. The Falcon 9 rocket deployed Pixxel's Firefly constellation, comprising three advanced high-resolution commercial hyperspectral satellites.

US to lift Cuba's terrorism tag in exchange for release of political prisonersThe Joe Biden administration said on Tuesday it would remove Cuba from its terrorism blacklist, while Cuba said separately it would release upward of 500 prisoners from its jails.

Kangana Ranaut's Emergency banned in Bangladesh amid strained ties: SourcesKangana Ranaut's film, Emergency, set to release in India on January 17, has been banned in Bangladesh. The ban is linked to the ongoing political tensions between both countries rather than the film's content.

Pics: Inside Sobhita Dhulipala, Naga Chaitanya's first Sankranti after weddingNaga Chaitanya and Sobhita Dhulipala celebrated their first Sankranti months after their wedding. The Made in Heaven actor gave us a sneak-peek of their Sankranti celebrations.

Viral: Arijit Singh recreates Chaleya hook steps at Ahmedabad concertSinger Arijit Singh danced to Shah Rukh Khan's Chaleya as he performed the song at the Ahmedabad concert. The video from the event went viral on social media.

Fans call Ranbir 'one of the best fathers' as he enjoys playtime with daughter RahaRanbir Kapoor was recently captured in a delightful video playing with his daughter, Raha. The video quickly went viral as it showcased Ranbir being a doting father.

Jo Jeeta Wohi Sikandar actor Ayesha Jhulka joins Celebrity MasterChef as wildcardBollywood star Ayesha Jhulka is entering Celebrity MasterChef as a wildcard contestant, marking her first major television role. The new season promises an exciting lineup with Farah Khan hosting and familiar judges returning.

sports.headline: Serie A: Lazio fire falconer for posting pictures of penis implant onlineLazio have decided to fire Juan Bernabé, the man who handled the club's official mascot, after the falconer posted pictures of his penis implant online.

Australian Open: Aryna Sabalenka survives 2nd set scare to beat Jessica Bouzas Defending champion Aryna Sabalenka survived an all-mighty scare in the second set to defeat a resolute Jessica Bouzas Maneiro to progress to the third round of the Australian Open 2025 on Wednesday, January 15.

Liverpool held to draw by Nottingham Forest, Manchester City let 2-goal lead slipLiverpool were forced to salvage a 1-1 draw against a resolute Nottingham Forest side, while Manchester City let a 2-0 lead slip to be held 2-2 draw by a determined Brentford on Tuesday, January 14 in the Premier League. Chelsea were able to secure a point against Bournemouth, while Graham Potter secured his first win as West Ham United manager.

Aakash Chopra questions India's T20 World Cup hero's absence in England seriesFormer India cricketer turned commentator, Aakash Chopra, has questioned the absence of India all-rounder Shivam Dube in the team for the upcoming T20I series against England.

Donyell Malen joins Aston Villa on permanent deal from Borussia DortmundAston Villa bolstered their attacking options by signing Dutch forward Donyell Malen from Borussia Dortmund for 23 million euros, with add-ons. Malen's experience and versatility are expected to strengthen Villa's push for European qualification and domestic success.

Steve Smith on being stuck at 9999 runs: Was thinking about Hazlewood's shirt noStar Australia batter Steve Smith opened up getting stuck at 9999 runs in Test cricket and revealed how he just kept thinking about Josh Hazlewood's jersey number ahead of the game.

Rishabh Pant set to play Ranji Trophy for Delhi, no confirmation over Virat KohliStar India wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant is all set to play for Delhi in their upcoming Ranji Trophy fixture against Saurashtra. However, there's no confirmation on Virat Kohli yet.

India edge closer to Kho Kho World Cup knockouts after outclassing BrazilTeam India triumphed over Brazil 64-34 at the Kho Kho World Cup 2025, while the Indian women's team secured a historic 175-18 victory over South Korea, setting the stage for a dominant display on Day 2.

Fonseca's reveals Roger Federer-inspired mantra behind Rublev stunnerJoao Fonseca, an 18-year-old tennis sensation from Brazil, stunned world No. 9 Andrey Rublev at the Australian Open and credited Roger Federer's advice for shaping his grounded approach amid rising fame.

Virat Kohli's time has gone: Former England cricketer on India star's futureFormer England cricketer David Lloyd has made a big statement on the future of the star India batter Virat Kohli saying that his time is over in Test cricket.

Manu Bhaker likely to get 'deteriorating' Paris Olympics medals replacedIndia's star shooter Manu Bhaker is likely to receive replacements for her deteriorating Paris Olympics bronze medals, as the organising committee collaborates with Monnaie de Paris to address widespread medal quality concerns reported by numerous athletes worldwide.

Australian Open 2025, Day 4 schedule: Alcaraz, Djokovic and Bhambri in actionThe Day 4 of the Australian Open 2025 will have several big names of tennis world in action as Novak Djokovic, Carlos Alcaraz, Aryna Sabalenka and Coco Gauff amongst others will be seen on the court.

Premier League clubs avoid Profit and Sustainability charges for 2021-2024 periodNo Premier League clubs have been charged with Profit and Sustainability (PSR) breaches for the three-year reporting period between 2021 and 2024.

PV Sindhu makes winning return, Satwik-Chirag survive tough testIndia Open 2025: PV Sindhu, Kiran George, Dhruv Kapila and Tanisha Crasto, along with the men's doubles pair of Satwiksairaj Rankireddy and Chirag Shetty, advanced to the second round. Sindhu defeated Sung Shuo Yun of Chinese Taipei in straight games, while Kiran survived a tense battle against Japan's Yushi Tanaka.

Success for Djokovic-Murray partnership is success for tennis: Somdev Novak Djokovic's partnership with former rival Andy Murray debuted at the Australian Open, marking a fascinating chapter in tennis history. The duo's journey began with a dramatic first-round victory against wildcard Nishesh Basavareddy, showcasing resilience and potential.

Watch: Vinod Kambli touches Gavaskar's feet at Wankhede's 50th anniversaryFormer India cricketer Vinod Kambli was recently felicitated by the Mumbai Cricket Association (MCA) at the 50th anniversary celebration of the Wankhede Stadium.

Pakistan-origin England pacer faces delay in securing Indian visa: ReportSaqib Mahmood's visa delays have kept him from joining England's training camp in Abu Dhabi, but the ECB remains hopeful he will join the squad in time for the T20 series against India, continuing his comeback after injury setbacks.

Rublev, Sakkari crash out; Jabeur, Medvedev march aheadAustralian Open 2025: Russian ninth seed Andrey Rublev and Greek Maria Sakkari crashed out after first-round losses while Ons Jabeur, Daniil Medvedev, and Alex de Minaur marched ahead on Tuesday.

Virat Kohli, Rishabh Pant named as probables in Delhi squad for Ranji TrophyStar India batter Virat Kohli and Rishabh Pant have been named as probables in Delhi's squad for the next round of the Ranji Trophy 2024-25

Watch: Vinod Kambli touches Gavaskar's feet at Wankhede's 50th anniversaryFormer India cricketer Vinod Kambli was recently felicitated by the Mumbai Cricket Association (MCA) at the 50th anniversary celebration of the Wankhede Stadium.

Pakistan-origin England pacer faces delay in securing Indian visa: ReportSaqib Mahmood's visa delays have kept him from joining England's training camp in Abu Dhabi, but the ECB remains hopeful he will join the squad in time for the T20 series against India, continuing his comeback after injury setbacks.

Virat Kohli, Rishabh Pant named as probables in Delhi squad for Ranji TrophyStar India batter Virat Kohli and Rishabh Pant have been named as probables in Delhi's squad for the next round of the Ranji Trophy 2024-25

Arsenal's Gabriel Jesus faces lengthy layoff with suspected ACL injuryArsenal's Brazilian forward Gabriel Jesus is facing an extended period out of action after reportedly sustaining a suspected anterior cruciate ligament (ACL) injury.

Sunil Gavaskar suggests ending optional practice sessions after recent Test debacleLegendary India cricketer Sunil Gavaskar has suggested the Indian team to do away with the optional practice sessions for players in the aftermath of back-to-back series loss against New Zealand and Australia.

Like Mumbai players, Kohli should play Ranji: Delhi cricket secretaryDDCA secretary Ashok Sharma urged Virat Kohli to participate in Delhi's Ranji Trophy matches, suggesting he take inspiration from Mumbai players like Rohit Sharma, who recently trained with Mumbai's squad despite not confirming his match participation.

Rift in Team India? BCCI to evaluate Gambhir's future post Champions TrophyGautam Gambhir's role as head coach is under scrutiny as India's Champions Trophy performance could determine his future, amid tensions over his efforts to dismantle the 'superstar culture' within the team. Concerns have arisen due to India's recent poor results and speculated rifts with key players, leading to a review by the BCCI.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
